derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from late Latin contemptibilis, from Latin contemnere (see contemn)

entry.tran: 可轻蔑的;可鄙的;卑劣的
entry.def: If you feel that someone or something is contemptible, you feel strong dislike and disrespect for them.

example.ex: Catherine was ready to explode. 'I think you're contemptible!'
example.tran: 凯瑟琳气得快要炸了。“我觉得你真是可鄙！”

means.word_mean: 2. worthy only of being despised and rejected;

sentences.sentence: "A little, wretched, despicable creature, a worm, a mere nothing...that has risen up in contempt against the majesty of Heaven and earth"- Jonathan Edwards

auth_sentence.content: All striving and perseverance...she considered contemptible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: All striving and perseverance...she considered contemptible.

auth_sentence.content: The unanimously applauded, self-congratulatory bromides of a Soviet Party Congress seemed contemptible.
auth_sentence.res_content: The unanimously applauded, self-congratulatory bromides of a Soviet Party Congress seemed contemptible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The unanimously applauded, self-congratulatory bromides of a Soviet Party Congress seemed contemptible.

auth_sentence.content: I must say that I am shocked by this contemptible and totally fallacious text.
auth_sentence.res_content: I must say that I am shocked by this contemptible and totally fallacious text.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I must say that I am shocked by this contemptible and totally fallacious text.

stems_affixes.word_buile: contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+ible..的→adj.令人轻视的
contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+uous……的→adj.表示轻蔑的,藐视的
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+atious→adj.诱惑性的
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→轻视,藐视
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+ation表名词→n.引诱,诱惑;诱惑物
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+temn=tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→蔑视
